review.reviewBody: For reference, my foot length is 25 cm and width 10 cm. I ordered these shoes from a retailer in a size EU 40 which ended up being an okay size but could’ve gone with 1/2 a size up. While I loved the teddy look of these, I ended up returning them. I just didn’t love them overall. I felt like they didn’t go well with my style. Also they could’ve been a bit more comfy.
review.name: Cute but not for me

review.reviewBody:
Read reviews and the suggestion to buy a size larger, was spot on. It's nice to have room for toes to move around and not feel "crowded"
Recommend these warm and toasty boots! Love the color as well.
review.name: Comfortable and cozy!!!

review.reviewBody: Kept my feet nice and warm! I got a half size up (instead of full) because I don’t live in extremely cold weather and intended to wear regular socks. If you wear thick socks you will need a full size up. I also recommend checking the “cm” sizes on shoes you have and the sizing guide for this shoe. It’ll help you decide on the size you need
review.name: Warm and waterproof

review.reviewBody: I am loving, my adorable, cozy, warm, waterproof stylin’ comfy little boots! I would say they are a TINY bit too small in length. I am typically a size 9 and my toe is touching the end. Also, they are a little wide since my foot is pretty narrow. I had to buy arches to stick in there, but that wasn’t a big deal. All in all I really like them.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: Purchased as a gift for my wife and she loves them. Warm and lightweight. She typically likes Uggs, so I wasn’t sure what she’d think, but with their warmth, waterproofing and style, she’s a huge fan.
review.name: Ugg on steroids!

review.reviewBody: Great compliments every time I wear these and super insulated and comfy.
review.name: Cute with skinny jeans and sweater

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! They are comfy, excellent quality, and well-insulated for a cold a day. I could walk all day in these boots.
review.name: Great Purchase!

review.reviewBody: I love my new slippers and boots. Excellent quality, comfort, support and will last a long time!
review.name: Sorels

review.reviewBody: Those are super cute, very comfortable and warm enough for the cold/snow weather. I went one size up for the room for thick socks. Waterproof is a big plus! Highly recommended.
review.name: Awesome Winter Boots!

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and very good looking !  Based on other reviews, I ordered 1/2 size larger and they are perfect.  Wear them everywhere
review.name: Best boots ever!

name: Explorer II Joan Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good fit and comfortable, once they're on. Putting them on is a bit of a struggle, getting the back strap over my heel takes a considerable amount of pulling/stretching. I could try a half size up,but there's a good chance that they would be too loose, once they're on.
review.name: Once they're on

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair of Newports, replacing my first pair. Previous ones have fit great. This one is so small that I will have to return it for replacement. Perhaps they have hanged manufacturers over time. Not sure that I can recommend that you purchase men's sandals on-line without trying them on.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my third pair and I love them I do get a lot of life out of them. I think this is in 10 years my third pair.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I have bought 10 pairs over the last twenty years. Being an avid walker, at least 5 miles a day, I just love these sandals. By far the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn. Highly recommend the original classic Newport leather sandals. Just fixing to purchase another pair as the quality has always remained top flight.
review.name: Ultimate in comfort

review.reviewBody: There is no leather on the inside of the saddle, the feet does not touch any leather at all, the leather is just for look, and it doesn’t help the feet.
review.name: There is no leather on

review.reviewBody: Not too bad a fit and reasonably comfortable if you follow the sizing guidelines
review.name: not too bad

review.reviewBody:
This is my 2nd pair of your bison sandals.... great product..
My first pair had a strap fail near my ankle after years of service!!
Thanks. DANE
review.name: This is my 2nd pair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Probably my fifth pair over at least ten years. Extremely comfortable and wear them year round even in the winter months in Alaska.
review.name: All time favorite

review.reviewBody:
I had my Keen sandals for years and they finally wore out past my ability to efficiently repair them. So, I bought new ones. Still a bit stiff, but they'll break in soon enough.

Comfy and breath well. I just pulled a trailer over my toe the other day and the sturdy leather really minimized the injury, which was nice. Also, I tend to stub my toes a lot and the sandals always protect my toes well when I do.

I hike and camp in them plenty and they always hold up well.
review.name: Solid Sandals

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve worn size 12 Keens in different styles for plus twelve years. These were too small! Quality is there. Styles discontinued much too often for my liking. I sent them back.
review.name: Bison

review.itemreviewed: Stumptown Mountain Pass GORE-TEX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I expected a little more from this boot. I ordered them for my wife. Perhaps I didn’t do enough research on the boot. I wonder if it’s more of an uphill boot and not ideal for northeast US hiking, rocky, roots, and sometimes wet. My wife has slipped several times on wet rocks while wearing these. Her latest fall resulted in a sprained ankle. At first, I thought she wasn’t being careful, but I was surprised when I compared her traction with mine on a wet rock. My shoes gripped much better on the wet surface than hers. Sorry for the long review, simply stated, these aren’t the boots for you if you intend to hike wet, rocky terrain. The boots are well made (except the sole) and nice to look at.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Stumptown Mountain Pass GORE-TEX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Was so unsure about these boots and the size that I even spoke to Danner twice. Set up to return them, but right before my hiking trip my old boots died. Brought these to hike allll around CO/pikes peak without breaking them in first. They were my ONLY shoes for the trip. Armed myself with blister bandaids, but they broke in so easily. So comfortable, great quality. **They fit my orthotics. The inner liner comes out and your orthotics will fit without issue. For those with tricky feet-look no further!** 
I decided on a 7.5, which is my normal size. I did not feel they would stretch enough with the 7s, and I was right. They rubbed a little at the Achilles and outer ankle when breaking in but are perfect after one long hike.  
Loooove them, buying a second pair in brown?because If you have hard to fit feet, ya buy as many pairs of the same comfortable, well fitting boot you can.
Perfect cute functional boot from trail to town. Waterproof. Quality. Perfection.
*note: they do look better worn in. Less police shiny shoe vibes.
review.name: THE boot for tricky feet people!

name: Stumptown Mountain Pass GORE-TEX Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Lizard Skins Micro Cache Saddle Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Micro Cache Saddle Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lizard Skins Micro Cache Saddle Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
It has a very streamlined shape where it tapers to become very narrow at the portion nearest the seat post. This makes it look cool, but not very conducive to storage. I had a hard time fitting a road tube+2 levers+ 1 can co2 and adapter + 1 SMALL multi tool. There was still volume left but it was difficult to close. I'd rather not have to play Tetris on the roadside, so I opted for the blackburn grid. To me the grid looks similar in size but it's rectangular, so I can actually fit a MTB tube + all that other stuff (and more). 

The Lizard skin would probably last longer than the one I went with. This thing seems to be expertly crafted. It is beautiful and made from a really nice, obviously water resistant material (almost like it's coated in wax). The zippers are covered with some other material that is water resistant as well.  My one other complaint is how it fastens. It has the traditional two straps for the seat bars and one strap for the seat post. If you want to keep it tight up under the seat, it may be difficult to open because of the zipper placement. You basically have to stick your fingers between the bag and seat, and I found that I needed to let it hang down slightly to make it a little more accessible. 

TLDR: Beautiful bag, so-so design. I would say if you don't carry an extra tube this thing will be a very decent choice, especially if you value appearance. If you do carry a road tube, you might consider going up to the next size, or looking elsewhere. It probably goes without saying, but if you need to carry a mtb tube, absolutely look into something bigger.
review.name: Really high quality, so-so design.

name: Micro Cache Saddle Bag

review.reviewBody: Been wearing this pretty much nonstop since i got it.  Replaced my old and beaten down Thermostatic jacket.  I love this new one.  Only complaint is that the outer fabric is structured with a weave and texture that tends to kinda make dirt stick to it, so it seems to pick up the filth a little quicker than some other jackets I've had, but this is a trivial thing.  I love the fit, form and function.  Super warm, good sized hood, nice wrist cuffs.  Pockets are good.  Overall, super impressed.
review.name: Very good jacket

review.reviewBody: Jacket for all uses. I wear mine around town as well as on high peaks. Durable. Warm. Great comfy fit. Fits well over a helmet.
review.name: All-Arounder Jacket

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality & price!!! Fits great, wonderful material.
review.name: Excellent quality & price!!!

review.reviewBody:
I've worn this jacket almost every day now for almost 2 months and it's served me well from 60 degrees all the way down to camping in 40 degrees with just a t-shirt underneath.
It's very lightweight, sheds moisture well so you always feel the same temperature when you're wearing it, and moves well with your body without riding up or shifting to feel off center.
I'm 6'1" average 200lbs. I normally wear xl shirts because they fit just right once they're washed. I got this jacket in Large and it fit's perfectly.
LOVE this jacket.
review.name: Great lightweight but very warm technical jacket!

name: Kor Stasis Hooded Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Skyline Carbon Ski- 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use this ski predominantly as my late-winter/spring touring/mountaineering ski.  I normally ski it with a ScarpaF1 boot.  I like the balance between stiffness/stability and weight.  In CO we also often have powder days through May and I find that it’s shape adapts well to all conditions corn —> powder. I’m fortunate to be able to ski all of the different models of Weston skis, and this one is becoming my favorite in the lineup due to its versatility and its ability to perform in a variety of snow conditions. I have skied some fairly big lines on this ski in variable conditions and would do it again.
review.name: My go-to spring touring ski

review.reviewBody: I got this ski over a season ago, and since then I haven't reached for another pair of skis. Whether you're in the deep or skiing spring corn, this ski tackles it all with ease. They're light enough to tuck way back into the woods on a long approach and strong enough to rip on steep, technical terrain. Snappy enough to make quick and efficient hop turns, and stable enough to straightline steeps. Truly a do it all ski, I can't speak highly enough of the construction.
review.name: Lightweight, backcountry setup

name: Skyline Carbon Ski- 2025

description: Buy the Scott Vivo Plus Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vivo Plus Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Scott Vivo Plus Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love this helmet, it's lightweight, well-ventilated, looks great, doesn't move around while riding, fits with all types of sunglasses, great padding, straps are very adjustable, and it fits my head extremely well with the adjustable boa system (I usually have problems with helmets tilting back on my head, not a problem with this one).
A go-pro mount fits perfectly on the center of the helmet, I use this for helmet lights.

It doesn't manage sweat as well as some other helmets, but riding through hot/humid PA weather, it hasn't bothered me at all. Just not the best in that category.

Not much else to say, helmets are personal preference but this is my favorite helmet I own.
review.name: Great Helmet

name: Vivo Plus Helmet

I’m 3 months postpartum wearing Size L and probably should be wearing a M in these.

review.reviewBody: Only 3 uses in and the valve that connects the drinking hose to the water sack has failed. Very disappointing.
review.name: Valve on water bag failure after 3 uses

review.reviewBody:
So I filled the bladder, popped in my Blackburn multi tool, co2 inflator, and two gu packets. The waist belt is so stretchy it will not hold it up on your hip. What initially feels comfortable, changes as soon as you start walking. The weight in the pack lets it flop around more than I'm comfortable with and I have had to pull it back up. I'm a bit chonky so it shouldn't just fall down over my butt. The bite valve is another area I'm not happy with. Initially I struggled to get more than mere drops of water. If you bite it right at the tip you can get a flow of water, but nothing to write home about. It's just restrictive and needs to be swapped out to a different style. Funny, as mine says to twist to unlock, but it just pulls and pushes straight in and out. There is no lock, per se. 

Storage is nice and convenient. The magnet on the hose works very well, however if the hose won't reach to one of the sewn loops, don't expect that plastic clip for the magnet to stay on the stretchy belt. 

I wouldn't buy this again. I wouldn't recommend it to anybody either because of the faults I outlined. There are other packs that don't have these issues. I will probably be buying some webbing and having that sewn in place of the stretchy belt instead
review.name: More butt than hip

name: Stash 3L Hip Bag

review.reviewBody:
I bought it to replace the Dana Design Arclight Glacier that I've had for more than 20 years and is starting to have some unravelling in the shoulder straps. Unfortunately I had to cancel my fall trip. I'll be stuffing it with some weight (rock salt bags) and doing some heavy pack training over the winter.
What I'd say about it is that it is heavy, but should last a lot longer than these Dyneema things they are pitching these days.
review.name: Haven't had a chance to use it yet

review.reviewBody:
In 1990 I bought a Dana Design Terraplane and Feathered Friends sleeping bag for a winter mountaineering trip in the Colorado Rockies.  Until 2022, I had both, but I gave the Terraplane away when I moved internationally.  After 30 years, it still had a lot of life in it!  I used that backpack for multiple backcountry ski mountaineering trips in the Rockies as well as travel in the Canadian wilderness, Africa, Nepal and 2 years backpacking in Southeast Asia.  I had a compatible Dana Design duffle that worked really well to cover the pack for international flights, and it also took the grease stains from rickety old boats and busses in SE Asia, keeping the backpack in good condition.  Over those 30 years, the only thing that needed replacing was the foam pad which broke down to years of exposure to sweat and the elements.  The pack comfortably carried everything I needed for winter trips. 

Over the decades, I wondered if a more modern, lighter backpack would be better, as the Terraplane always felt a bit heavy / burly--but that's probably why it lasted decades.  The other issue I didn't like was that the lid compartment was large and would flop around unless totally filled.  A minor issue was that the OG version didn't have a quick access to the length of the main compartment.  Bear in mind, these comments are not for this updated version.

Now I'm back in the market to replace it, and I see that the bag is back in production.  Surprisingly, the weight difference between it and some other options isn't that much.  I'm inclined to get the new Terraplane because it's such a good bag, though now that I'm older, it's probably overkill for me.  Adjusted for inflation, it's cheaper now than back in 1990, and if the new version is as good as the older one, it will no doubt last me the rest of my life.

I've attached photos of my original Terraplane as a testament to how well it held up.  Sorry if this review isn't entirely relevant, but I saw a few other OG Terraplane reviews, so I thought I'd add my own.
review.name: A durable, versatile classic

review.reviewBody: Bought this a few weeks ago for a backpacking trip with my kids since I knew I would be carrying more than my fair share of the gear. This pack carried the load really well even stuffed to the brim and with items strapped to the webbing.
review.name: Carries heavy loads well

review.reviewBody:
Bought this and took it on a trekking trip in Iceland. Multiple days across 40 miles of mountains valleys, the pack perform very well. 

The storage for a sleeping bag on the bottom is  great. Very simplistic and functional concept. That makes it easy to steal your bed roll.

I imagine the two outer tube style zipper pouches would also do very well if you were backpacking out meat after a hunt.
review.name: Haul everything

review.reviewBody:
Recently purchased for extended backpacking excursions.
Concerned about hook and loop longevity due to the taking out the yoke every time to use hood for daypack.  Use of the main pack shoulder straps are overkill when used with small and non-ergonomic to the back hood for day hikes from base camp.  Seems the older waist pack version is a more practical, durable and capable design.  Thinking of sewing on waist straps for waist pack/fanny pack use.  Is this something Mystery Ranch can do?
review.name: Quality!

review.reviewBody: Tried it out and works well. I will use this spring/summer/fall in the Sierras.
review.name: Well built

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace my decades-old Dana Design.  I haven't had a chance to take it out on the trail but the features seem great and same basic design.  It's also much lighter weight than my old one.  Looking forward to logging some miles!
review.name: Seems great

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Terraplane to replace my original Dana Terraplane from 1995.
 A couple of issues though. The 2 section top pocket is a waste of space and added weight. I never know where I put anything up there in the 2 small pockets and it won't take a map unless it's folded up small. The one pocket top pocket as on the original is more functional. 
 The sleeping bag compartment seems much smaller than the original Terraplane.  The buckle system on the sleeping bag compartment is just more weight and will wear more rapidly. 
 Seems good for carrying weight but the 2 mentioned downfalls are a definite minus.
review.name: Revisions needed

review.reviewBody: This new Terraplane is a near identical replacement for my much loved 1994 Terraplane that served me well all over the world for nearly 30 years.  The new M. R. Terraplane has some smart upgrades and keeps the DNA of the old versions.  The waist belt  and shoulder yoke are big upgrades in comfort and fitting.  It took a little bit to fit the pack to me but once I got it adjusted it fits like a glove.  I'm looking forward to another 30 years out of this pack. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I'll need several years to judge it's long term durability.  It's got big shoes to fill.
review.name: A near identical replacement for my 1994 Terraplan

review.reviewBody: I got the Dana Designs (now Mystery Ranch) Terraplain backpack in 1996. It is by far the very best pack I have ever owned. I hiked across the Olympic mountains for 11 days on a very rugged route. Half of the trek was cross country with no trail. I started with 80 pounds but it felt lighter. It was an epic trip and the Terraplain pack made all the difference. It was High Divide trail, Bailey Range Traverse, Skyline Route, North Fork Quinault rainforest trail.
review.name: Since 1996

name: Terraplane 83L Backpack
Terraplane 83L Backpack

But it feels great when it’s new.
review.name: Great feel, but…

review.reviewBody: I agree with the reviewer before me.  This tape wears way too quickly.  I was reluctant to purchase it again, but it is cheaper than many others.  Now we know why.
review.name: Zipp bar tape

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are good for hiking but not for trail running. The EVA midsole in this case is very tough for me. The tip is reinforced what provides a good protection for your toes. Big advantage is weight.
review.name: Good Hiking Shoe

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: HAVE NOT TRIED THEM ON YET.  BUT PRETTY SURE I WILL LIKE THEM.
review.name: FIT WELL GOOD CONSTRUCTION.  HAVE OTHE SIMILIAR V9

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve purchased my 4th pair of these shoes because they have been great in the past. This new pair make a lot of noise when walking in them. A distracting amount of noise. May return them.
review.name: Same shoe, but something changed
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: They look so much better out of the box, and they feel so comfortable
review.name: First sight

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m a caddie, and during the late Fall and Winter I rely on my Salomon GTX shoes. They keep my feet dry even though heavy downpours. I’ve only worn these new shoes for two caddie gigs, but they performed as well as my old pairs. No break in period required, and they are super supportive across every type of terrain.
review.name: Immediately Comfortable and Waterproof

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: They look very nice, but they are a little stiff and your feet gets somewhat moist when used more than 45 minutes. Another downside is that you need to remove the insoles and put in a Spenco or Super Feet insoles, because the originals are thin and worthless other than that they are very nice.
review.name: Nice looking shoes, but a little stiff

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've bought 5+ pairs of these shoes, and the lacing system always breaks well before soles wear down or the rest of the shoe should need replaced. You can buy a replacement lace kit, but it seems impossible to relace through the super-small eyelet. Very poor design.
review.name: Lacing system is awful
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have worn these shoes about 3 weeks, and they are the best shoes I have ever owned. Seriously. They are firm on the heel, and I can't feel train rocks on my soles.  The tightening system took a bit of getting used to, but it is brilliant.  Very happy with these!
review.name: Not a huge runner bur really great shoes

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought I would change up my colour choice this time normally I get the all black XA Pro, this time I added some colour to my footwear…. I always buy Goretex they keep my feet dry in the rain, snow or dew in the grass, Goretex also allows your feet to breath. I wear these for everyday shoes, they provide good traction, reasonable padding, great lacing system. Dressy enough for my lifestyle. This pair is probably my tenth or twelfth pair. The sizing is pretty bang on, I wear merino wool socks all year.
review.name: Best Shoes Ever

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love these and will be buying another pair. I've had mine for a year and it's time for a new pair - the only weakness to them is the lower loops for the laces that are not reinforced like the remaining loops and are starting to tear. .
review.name: Great shoe

name: XA Pro 3D V9 Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Teva Verra Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Verra Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teva Verra Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I must have fat feet, because I couldn't get the top strap to fasten - I need the strap to be longer. I've had this problem with other models of Teva sandals over the last few years.
review.name: Didn't fit right

review.reviewBody: I've only worn these sandals three times and already the strap by my outside ankle is becoming separated from the insole, on both sandals. I guess a very poor glue job, poor construction. I wish they were sewn. I agree with the other reviewer who dislikes the indented lines on the insole, which collect sweat and dirt. I've had to clean out the indented lines after each of my (three) wears, with a metal tool, then I clean the insoles with alcohol pads. It's too bad these sandals are poorly made, because they're cute and comfortable. This was my first Teva purchase and now I can't trust the brand. In terms of sizing, they're sized small. I ordered a 6.5, my normal sandal size, and had to return them for a 7.
review.name: Inferior glue job

review.reviewBody: Disappointed. Cross straps have tabs rub into ankles. Wore them around house for a day and was uncomfortably abraded. Had to send them back.
review.name: Cross strap tabs rub into ankles

review.reviewBody: If you have bunions this is just the perfect pair of sandals, I spent so much time looking for a good pair that was comfortable in the bunion area, and this one have plenty space and I love the arch support. Just perfectly for my feet
review.name: Super recommended

review.reviewBody: I ordered this pair online, and I was excited to try the Verra style since I have several other pairs of Teva sandals. However, I was disappointed to realize that this shoe style has a shorter ankle strap (compared to the Hurricane XLT2 and others). I had to return them because the strap barely connected with the Velcro and they didn't feel as secure on my feet. Also, it looked odd to have the strap end halfway across my ankle.
review.name: Short ankle straps

review.reviewBody: I purchased this sandal is 2018 and walked all over the DC area in them. They are very comfortable and can be worn in various settings. I figured it was finally time for a replacement pair of sandals and they didn't disappoint!
review.name: This sandal is the best! Comfortable for many miles!

review.reviewBody: So, got these and put them on to wear around the house to get used to them......perfectly comfortable from the get go. No breaking in required. Felt like walking barefoot.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: These are so cute and are very comfortable. The downsides are that they are a little shorter than my other Tevas of the same size and the foot bed seems cheaper. There are toe marks on them and some of the black comes off on my feet after wearing them only a few times and very casually. I'm going to keep them but wouldn't buy them again.
review.name: Comfortable but footbed is not great

review.reviewBody: These sandals are cute and very comfortable. However, my problem is with the quality. After wearing them for a week the straps started to peel away from the base of the shoe. I've bought Teva sandals in the past at this same price point and they're still in great shape. Naturally, I expected the same quality from these but have been disappointed. I would give them five stars if it weren't for this problem.
review.name: Not the quality Teva is known for

review.reviewBody: I have arthritis in my feet and theses are the only sandals I can wear!! I bought two pair if the same and wore them straight from the box!! So comfy!!!
review.name: I would buy these every year!!

name: Verra Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I really like these tops, I ordered them in two colors. These are a slightly longer crop fit, which feels much more functional than your typical crop top. The material is really nice. Excellent for outfit layering. 
Two slightly annoying things with the built-in bra -- the two cup pieces tend to slide around, and I'm not sure if they're removable. It's kind of awkward to position them correctly. Also the bra band on the inside can fit a bit tight. By the end of the day I had a red mark around my ribs from it. 
Overall though, I like these tops and they're very flattering.
review.name: Adorable crops, built in bra

hasVariant.name: Cloudcap II Fleece Glove - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Columbia Cloudcap II Fleece Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The gloves are very warm and comfortable. Don’t let the thin profile fool you. The lining in these is excellent, but I wouldn’t spent hours building a snowman or having a snowball fight without an extra layer. Great for every day wear and the shorter fun times in that fresh pow.
review.name: Thin, BUT very warm.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Although made to look like winter gloves that would sustain (Minnesota) frigid temps and snow, these gloves failed. The cold went right through as soon as I walked outside and my fingers were numb within 5 minutes.
review.name: Not for Winter
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Suprized are how effecctive and warm these gloves are.  Bonus that I can use my phone without remiving them.
review.name: Suprizingly warm

review.reviewBody: I've had many Columbia products over the years, and I think these gloves are by far the most disappointing. To be fair, I can't seem to find a decent pair of gloves in the past few years, so my search continues. Just used them to take the dog for a walk here in Portland-- misty and 40 degrees. I don't get cold easily, and I agree with some other reviewers that they just don't keep your fingers warm. This could be because the fit is wrong. As some others have mentioned, the width is correct, but the fingers are too long and I ordered a size small. My hands were freezing after a short 15-minute walk. Sadly, I think I might be returning these!
review.name: Disappointing
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought to be used on our horse farm as gloves while grooming and riding as thinner gloves. Definitely not warm enough below 35-40 degrees. Touch fingers are a nice feature to have for phone use at the barn. Fingers on the glove are a bit too long.
review.name: Decent, not warm enough below 35-40 degrees

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Decent looking gloves to have as a nice pair. Not warm enough for temps below 35. Fingers are a bit too long. Size chart is accurate for the hand width measurements.
review.name: Nice looking gloves. Not warm enough for below 35

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Definitely not a ski/ snow gloves. Can wear this gloves under a thick insulated snow gloves but never alone. I wore this gloves today at 35F temperature. The gloves were cold as if it’s absorbing the 🥶 cold not even 10% warm. It’s good for fall season, little bit windy and cold like 60F. My hands were freezing cold and getting numb as I can’t go back home to wear it again. it doesn’t serve what they promised for. 
Plus the touchscreen on index finger is bulky and not stitched right according to women finger. It should be small pointy delicate. Not thick bulky like a man’s finger. It’s really difficult to even unlock my phone. If I have to text someone this is a worst glove to wear. I had to tap multiple times just to record one video. It’s irritating and annoying when you are freezing cold. No warm, not touchscreen accessible.
review.name: Definitely not warm!!
comment: We are sorry to hear these gloves did not perform as expected! We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not for super cold weather. Wore for the first time today in 31° frosty weather. My leather gloves are warmer. Probably resort to these for running errands, giving my leather gloves a break, etc. Material is slick, so it's difficult to keep grasp of, let's say, my coffee tumbler in the morning. Seems to be ok quality. I can feel the unfinished hems inside though. My extremities are very sensitive to cold and I also have sensory issues lol. I've spent more on worse is what I'll keep telling myself lol!
review.name: Just Ok
comment: Thanks a bunch for sharing your thoughts with us! We'll definitely pass this along to the right teams for some product fine-tuning. Appreciate you choosing Columbia!

name: Cloudcap II Fleece Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: Super adorable pair of carhartt jeans for kids/toddler.
review.name: Perfect gift for my nephew!!!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my grandson and they are really good and durable.
review.name: Really good and durable

review.reviewBody: Great pants. Every time my grandson out grows a pair I buy the next size.

Ordered these for our 3-yr old. He's a little short, and solidly built, but definitely not chubby. The 4T were plenty long, as expected, but the waist was too snug. I interpreted 'adjustable waist' as stretchy waist like most toddler pants. But the waist is all canvas, with a stretchy internal 'belt' so you can make it fit tighter. But at its loosest, it was still too tight for him. It would be nice if there were more pictures showing the waistline, because I wouldn't have ordered them if I'd seen how it's actually designed. Otherwise, it's your standard sturdy carhartt pant.
review.name: Waist not stretchy enough

review.reviewBody: Legs a little long for 18 months but they role up nice and maybe the boy short legs for all thus grandpa knows!  They have already saved him a lot of knee skin.  Happy that we also but 24 month pants.
review.name: Short legs long legs

review.reviewBody: Love, love Carhartt, great quality, stylish, my grandson has a bunch of Carhartt clothing tuff just like him,  very comfortable
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love them! Our little guy wears them all the time. Great pants for a active toddler!
review.name: Great pants for a toddler

review.reviewBody: I first ordered a 3T since that’s the size of jeans my son wears. But they came all the way up to his armpits. The 2t fits a lot better.

These run on the large side, which is great for growing kids. Very durable, will outgrow before wearing them out for sure. Softer than the grown up version, which is nice for little legs, but have the same Carhartt durability.
review.name: Great for active toddlers

name: Canvas Dungaree Pant - Toddler Boys'

description: Buy the Marmot Olden Polartec 1/2-Zip Top - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Olden Polartec 1/2-Zip Top - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Olden Polartec 1/2-Zip Top - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really nice finish of a thick fleece pullover.  Perfect as an insulation layer when hiking, skiing, climbing, etc.  definitely warm and very well made.   Will be taking this to my next northern back packing trip this summer where the temperatures drop to 45 degrees.  This pullover will definitely keep me warm.  Highly recommend this item, it's comfortable, well made and warm!
review.name: Great fleece pullover!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ordered this for my son and ended up keeping to myself. True to size but it fits close to your body. Nice mid layer although I thought it was a bit thick.
review.name: nice mid layer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Plush and soft on the inside, this is super comfortable. Light, yet warmer than other fleeces of this weight and thickness. I love this fleece so much I quickly ordered another one so I always have one at hand even when one is in the laundry. Also love the high recycled content.
review.name: My favorite fleece!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While this 1/2 zip is very lightweight while also providing warmth and flexibility, I cannot recommend it because it pilled after one wash. This is not a budget piece of clothing, so my expectations were higher. Skip this one.
review.name: Pilling after one wash
comment:
Hello,
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the jacket is pilling after first wash.

If washed according to the laundering instructions from our website and the laundry tag, the item should not have this issue. To get red of the pilling, we might recommend using a razor or fabric shaver.

If the issue will still occur, please submit a warranty claim on our website and we will take a closer look.

We will make sure to forward your feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may investigate the issue. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via [URL-https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us] or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am-5pm Eastern Time.
Thank you! Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I rarely write reviews but I have to for this. Powerstretch is just awesome. If you haven't tried it before, you're missing out. Marmots execution of it with the Olden is probably my favorite. Warm for how lightweight and insanely comfortable it is. Some of the highlights are the well designed thumbholes, there are actual zipper pulls instead of just the cheap little knots, makes it easier to pull zippers with gloves. The sleeves are also long for a large and that combined with the smooth exterior fabric make is easy to layer. Quality is spot on. I got the yellow gold and it is much darker in person. Probably going to pick up a few more of these!
review.name: One of my favorites!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This half zip has a great cut that hugs your body and a nice stretchy fit, so it's not too tight.  It's a bit thicker than other fleece half zips Marmot sells, so it is warmer as well.  I plan to wear this for skiing as well as everyday wear in the winter.  I am 5'11" and 165 lbs living in MN and I bought a medium.
review.name: Looks good and feels warm

name: Olden Polartec 1/2-Zip Top - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket since the back end of 2021 and I love it. It keeps the wind out.....keeps me warm...but not too warm and fits great. Buy one....you won't regret it.

review.reviewBody: My box did not come with any paperwork in it for me to return my shoes. Please help me with returning them. Thank you.
review.name: Heel too high for wish to return. Please tell me how.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these wonderful sandals. I wear them as "house shoes" due to degenerative disc disease. These allow me to do lots of housework without horrible neck and back aches. No other athletic sandal compares and I've tried so many! I love the memory foam footbed and their comfortable straps. Pleas never stop making these!!!
review.name: Best And Most Comfortable Shoe Ever!

review.reviewBody: The shoe is so comfortable and I see a lot more colors I want also
review.name: I will definitely be buying more!

review.reviewBody: My first order, the shoe was too small. I was able to create the return online from the payment receipt email which was fast and easy. No sooner did I drop off the return to the post office that I received an email that the replacement was shipped already and on it way! After receiving the second pair, I absolutely love the shoes!!! Very comfortable and true to the description.
review.name: Quick exchange

review.reviewBody: I'm a licensed boat Captain and spend long hours standing are helm- these shoes are divinely comfortable. So cushioned and supportive. However once they get wet- no matter how much you rinse, wash, treat, dry- they smell like a cat box... not sure why Teva can't manage to get a true anti-bacterial material to construct the foam footbed from to prevent this. I own two pairs and the same thing happened to both within a month of purchase. None of the other styles I've ever worn have this problem.
review.name: Love the comfort/hate the smell

review.reviewBody: I got these to wear with some new baggy stencil cargo pants because I needed a platform sandal. These are perfect! Just the right height to keep the baggies from dragging and SO COOL looking. And like everyone else says - comfortable as heck.
review.name: Really Great for Wide Leg Pants

review.reviewBody: These are really comfortable! I love the insole material.
review.name: Buying a pair for my daughter

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable sandals I've ever owned! I wear them all day at work! The fit is perfect!
review.name: I love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: The memory foam footbed looks amazing, but I haven't worn them out of the house yet.
review.name: Haven't worn yet

review.reviewBody: Love how they look and how comfy they are. They are perfect to wear with shorts, but especially any pants that that drag with regular shoes. They give me that lift while being a casual sandal and not a bulky clog or heels.
review.name: Stylish and sooo comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got these as an early Christmas gift from my parents. They were a little snug at first (as they should be for anyone buying online) but after a long day of use they were super comfortable. I have some experience with Red Wings, I own the Iron Ranger and the Classis Moc. Out of those 3 the Classic Chelsea has been the easiest to break-in. The build quality is good.
review.name: Easy to Break-In

review.reviewBody:
Bought these boots originally about a month ago. I have a pair of boots from a PNW boot maker that I love, but needed a Chelsea style boot for a work situation where I would need to take my shoes off and put them back on multiple times per day. That boot maker doesn't make a Chelsea, so I went looking elsewhere. I hadn't tried any Red Wing heritage products before, but had heard that people love the Iron Rangers and Moc Toe boots so I decided to give these a try since they seemed close to the type of boots I had come to like. Boy, was I wrong.

I was confused when I first put the boots on. The foam insoles were topped with leather which was... odd for a heritage boot. I figured it was maybe to make the boots more approachable by adding some under-foot comfort and who doesn't like that? 

Once I got the boots home, I realized that the pair I was sold was actually two different sizes in the same box. The store claimed they were like that from the factory and seemed to struggle to figure out what to do about this. No big deal - they figured out they'd order me a new pair. That's fine. Except that it wasn't. 

The new pair I had received (and already paid for) had some obviously wacky stitching in the welt around the big toe on the right boot. Just cosmetic, I figured. But a defect nonetheless. 

So I wore them for a couple days until the boots tried to eat a hole through the back of my heel. I reached a hand in  to make sure there was no debris or anything that would be making this happen only to find the debris was actually a piece of the boot. There's a sharp piece of plastic Red Wing is trying to pass off as a heel counter covered by the world's thinnest leather liner. That vicious heel counter feels like it's covered with a paper thin layer of leather. 

As I explored the boot, I realized the leather liner stops and becomes... synthetic something? I don't know what the toe liner material is. 

It would be possible to let any of these individual transgressions against the boot gods slide, but once those plastic heel counters announced themselves too loudly to ignore, it brings all the elements into focus in a way that makes me regret I bought these.

For the price, I'd expect a heritage boot. Is Red Wing's heritage building boots with plastic parts? The thinnest possible linings? Switching to synthetic materials in places they don't expect people to look? Misplacing stitches with no apparent quality control? If so, Red Wing's heritage doesn't deserve to be carried on any further and definitely doesn't deserve another dollar of mine or yours.

I added a star because the boots almost look nice (except for the wonky stitching) and the upper leather appears to be of decent quality.
review.name: Overpriced, Poor Quality
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that our boots did not live up to your expectations. We stand behind our products with an industry-leading warranty. We will contact you directly to discuss your options!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve owned these boots for 3 years now. For reference, I wear them about 6 months out of the year and a couple times throughout the summer time. 

Let me start by saying there really isn’t a “break in” period with these. Right out of the box, they are very comfortable. As you wear them, they obviously will mold to your foot bed. 

The quality is 8.7 out of 10. The elastic is starting to get pretty stretched out. The leather itself is awesome if you take care of it. 

Overall, I highly suggest buying this boot! Whether it’s dress up or just going to the store, these are perfect to slip on and go.
review.name: Review after 3 years
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear we have lived up to your expectations. We hope that you continue to have lasting comfort with these. We can't wait to see you again!

review.reviewBody: Great shoe.  Fits well.  Tight to get my foot into through the stretch gussets but then when my foot is inside the shoe is bigger than my regular size 12.  Should have sized down to a 11 1/2.
review.name: Very comfortable but runs big
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. It is true, they do run big. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair of amber harness less than a year ago, very comfortable, very stylish boot. Really like that these can be dressed up or down. The break in period was really short for a traditional Goodyear Welted boot. Leather is top notch and has aged very well in the last 6 months with a nice patina from two or three conditionings with Red Wing leather cream. The one issue I have is the poor QC on multiple pairs - first pair I had were warrantied with a seam falling apart at the vamp after two weeks of wear, now this pair the elastic on is coming apart, both boots have this issue. Would still recommend these boots! Solid 4.5 and I love em, just wish the QC would get stepped up.
review.name: Comfortable boot, stylish, poor qc
comment: Thank you for your review- I am happy to hear you enjoy your boots, besides the few QC issues you had with multiple pairs. We will send this over to the Product/ Design Team to let them know to see if we can make improvements to this model. We hope to serve you again in the future.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing these for only two weeks and I don’t want to take them off they’re so comfortable. I was on the fence about getting these, but I couldn’t be happier with them. I’m a size 8.5 in Iron Rangers and a 9 in these and other Redwings - the longer I have these the better they look and feel to me, great boots!
review.name: Most comfortable redwings
comment: Thank you for this great review! I am so glad you love them!

review.reviewBody: Great boots, very high quality and well made. Hope to be wearing these the next few years.
review.name: Great boot
comment: Thank you for this kind review! We are so glad your happy with them! Let us know if we can be of assistance in the future.

review.reviewBody: No significant flaws in the construction. The inner lining is purely synthetic, so be aware of that. The insole appears to be a few layers of foam and leather stuck to the midsole instead of stitched. The shoe is comfortable overall. It isn’t as considered and well constructed as Grant Stones, which I have a few of as well. Oh well, it’s still better than most footwear these days
review.name: Not as well built as Grant Stones, but still good
comment: Thank you for your honest review. I am sorry to hear your boots did not have a longevity up to your expectations. We hope you will give our brand another chance in the future.

review.reviewBody: I don’t typically like the Chelsea style, but these in black with the wedge sole hit different. They look very modern and straddle the line between work and dress boot perfectly. Amazing quality for the price. My first pair of redwings, impressive quality. I wear a 13 in most sneakers, size 12 on these fit me perfectly.
review.name: Unique Chelsea
comment: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear we have lived up to your expectations as far as value and quality. We can't wait to see you again soon!

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my husband and he wears them every single day. They look awesome and are such great quality - may be pricey but absolutely worth it!
review.name: Love these!
comment: Thank you for your review. It's exciting that the boots  are doing the trick for your husband! We can't wait to continue serving you far into the future.

name: Classic Chelsea Wide Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great - I really like the fit, performance, and the touch screen sensitivity which works well, unlike others where the functionality just isn't how they intend. The print options are a bonus, since they stand out! Highly recommend GripIt if you are on the hunt for a new pair of gloves.
review.name: Something Different

review.reviewBody: Its rare that I find a glove that I like for every type of riding from enduro to road to gravel. But GripIt has cracked the code on a glove that's truly fit for all sorts of riding. These are some of the best fitting gloves I've ever worn. No bunching at the palms, no pinching at the bottom of my fingers, plus they're surprisingly breathable too for how durable the palm is. Just make sure you follow the sizing chart because GripIt's size range encompasses everything from little kids up through NBA player sized hands.
review.name: Truly a glove for all rides!

name: All Ride Glove

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Mine made it a little past 2 years and 100 miles before the waterproof membrane in one boot failed.  It's a shame, I absolutely loved them.
review.name: Didn't last very long

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I have purchased many pairs of Moab’s in the past with no issues. The speed solo IS NOT waterproof. I work in an office and wore these on a day after a hard rain. Well I stepped in one puddle ( not deep and did not splash inside the boot) and the inside of my boots were wet. Maybe these would be good for hiking in Arizona, but nowhere that is a bit wet. At least they look cool.
review.name: Not as advertised
comment: Hi! We're sorry to hear of your experience and would like to do all we can to help. Please give the team a call at 800.288.3124 or live chat at Merrell.com. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Granted it has only been a few weeks, but so far comfort is great and they do seem to be waterproof. I have been wearing them in the snow and rain and my socks have stayed dry. 
I did follow the recommendation I saw to order a half size larger and that was good as it is a perfect fit.
review.name: Loving my shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This pair of Merrill's is my second of this type: moderate hiking, lightweight, durable, comfortable, and waterproof.  These are all qualities I find very desirable for the type of walking I do.  I am not an avid trail hiker and do most of my walking in my residential neighborhood in Portland, Oregon.  My walks are frequent, usually 2 miles, covering varied terrain (sidewalks, park fields, and city pathways) and routes.  I am more the flaneur than the inveterate hiker.  My Merrill’s are very supportive and comfortable, and their being waterproof is a particularly appreciated quality for Portland’s rainy late falls and winters.  Wet grass…no problem!  To boot (no pun intended here) they are also attractively designed.
review.name: Made For My Walks
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and fun with one issue. I noticed after wearing them ONCE, that the right shoe makes a popping sound with every step. I can feel material in the shoe flexing and popping under the toes on my right foot with each step. I would give the review 5/5 if it weren’t for what seems like a manufacturing flaw on one shoe.
review.name: Comfortable shoes. One shoe has an issue.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own a bunch a Merrells, they hold up well and are light and comfortable. I liked the way these looked. they are a little different from previous Merrill high-tops I've owned. they are super light and VERY comfortable. so far i am impressed. I sell land for a living and am in the office one minute then in the woods the next. My shoes and boots are important. These are a win:)
review.name: Love'em!
comment: We're happy you love them! Thanks for sharing!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable and very lightweight.  Have hiked numerous times over varied terrain.  Best hikng boots I have ever had.
review.name: Very comfortable and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I haven’t owned more comfortable hiking shoes as these. They are my absolute favorite pair and they look amazing. I get at least one compliment every time I wear them.
review.name: My favorite hiking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work in the agriculture industry and walk a lot of fields every day. So far I’ve been really impressed with the all-day comfort of these boots. They don’t make my feet sweaty even though the are waterproof. I can’t take it easy on them walking through muddy corn fields every day and they do just fine. Hopefully they last as long as my last pair of Merrells!
review.name: Great boots for the hiking trail or corn field!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: We originally bought these because I needed new hiking boots, but so far I’ve worn them to work as a mail carrier and on our vacation to Washington DC and to NYC, where we walked the entire trip. They have good support and cushion, which helps with the shock on knees and lower back. I inadvertently checked out the waterproofness of the boot, by accidentally stepping in a puddle and submerging it and my foot stayed dry.
review.name: Great boot, not just for hiking!
comment: Thank you for your excellent review!

name: Speed Solo Mid WP Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: It's soft, it fits really well (5'8", size M), and is good for being on the run outside, the casual office day, or the brewery.
review.name: I love this thing

review.reviewBody: My favorite shirt, had to order another.  I have this hoodie in the half zip and the non zippered model, both amazing pieces of clothing.  Whether you are curled up on the couch with you special someone or on the third and most grueling pitch of ice this shirt is great.  Soft wool that doesn't itch and is super durable.  I've been wearing them for years now and washing them and they have yet to spring a hole it run in them.  The "hand panties" option on the cuff is a nice feature for the walks in the park when it is brisk or to cover your hands on a cool day that is sunny while rowing a raft.
review.name: fav

review.reviewBody: Great shoe. fits true to size. Looks really good. not the most comfortable in the world but certainly not uncomfortable
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Stunning shoe but not a great fit for my feet. Tried a full size up but just too tight all round
review.name: Another Beautiful Shoe
comment: We are sorry to hear your NB Numeric 574 Vulc did not fit as expected, and thank you for your feedback. Finding the right size is key to comfort, and we would love to help you with that. Please reach out to us.

review.reviewBody:
Very comfy and look fab. My new faves. 
I think another reviewer thought they were similar spec to vans but I disagree - room in the toe box but don’t make my feet look huge and supportive insole. I’ll definitely buy again.
review.name: I love them!
comment: Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback! We're thrilled to hear that you find the NB Numeric 574 Vulc both comfortable, and good-looking. It’s great to know that the toe box provides the right amount of room without compromising on aesthetics, and that you appreciate the supportive insole. We thank you for your trust and for being a valued customer, your satisfaction is very important to us! Enjoy your new favourites!

review.reviewBody: Fit really well even with slightly wider feet. Also available in half sizes. Good insoles too.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: New Balance are sometimes referred to as grandpa shoes, but these are definitely not. For those looking for a casual yet classy everyday shoe.
review.name: A little retro, but still CLASSY

review.reviewBody: Comfortable balance, sleek especially if you kmow how to rock it well! Maybe i may become a model for new balance someday! 😊😊but for real, these particular one is mard❤️
review.name: Balance

review.reviewBody: I’m hooked on New Balance’s skate show line. I’ve bought six pairs in the last year. Stylish, comfy, and great price.
review.name: Love New Balance Skate Line

review.reviewBody: Amazing.  I bought it as birthday gift for my hubby and he loved it.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody:
My feet thank you!
Awesome quality hardwaring product that looks great!
review.name: Happy feet

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a warm (1st priority), waterproof boot that I could wear to go on snowy walks and shovel the drive, but also something somewhat stylish that I could wear out in town (not pack boots). These boots fit the bill perfectly. Exceptionally warm and waterproof. Met the test of slushy snowy walks and driveway shoveling. Unfortunately, HH did not think to add loop/tab on the back to help with pulling the boot on, which would be helpful, and thus the only reason I didn't give 5 stars. Other than that, very happy with the purchase. Boots fit true to size, and pack out slightly so no need to size up.
review.name: Nice warm and functional/stylish boot

name: Garibaldi V3 Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Oseus Vpd Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Oseus Vpd Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great pads ..except in the cold (bellow 45)they become “frozen like” stiff
review.name: Poc Oseus vpd

review.reviewBody: Excellent product. Unfortunately I found they would have dug into my hamstring tendons behind the knee on every pedal stroke, so they were a showstopper for me.
review.name: Wish my skinny legs would have approved.

review.reviewBody: This knee pad fits a bit snug based on the sizing, but not so restrictive that it's noticable. I will say the fit is amazing...when it stays in place.  It does slide down over time, possibly due to the shape of my thigh, which will cause the backside material to fold or bunch up.  This bunching uncomfortably cuts into the back of my knee.  Mind you, this is an improvement over the hefty, hot, and shifty VPD 2.0. Also, not sure it's worth the cost compared to other slip-on pads (no straps to tension).
review.name: So close...

review.reviewBody: These are fantastic knee pads.  I'm 6'2", 175 lbs and ordered a large per the size chart on POC's official website.  They have nice solid padding that is ventilated and cups the knee well, and the side protection is a nice touch.  Very breathable for this level of protection, great fabric, grippy silicone that keeps them in place and they didn't rub me a bit.  Would recommend for aggressive XC, trail and enduro.  They felt great right out of the box, so I went big and did 18.5 miles yesterday for my first ride in these pads, including 2,750 ft of climbing... it was about 90 degrees and high humidity (typical Knoxville summer weather).  Stayed put the whole dang time and didn't make me feel like I was riding in knee warmers.  I've tried nearly every knee pad out there, and I'm very picky.  10/10 would recommend these.  My other favorites are the Leatt Airflex Pro (cooler but not as much protection) and the 7iDP Sam Hill pads (very similar level of protection and breathability to these POCs).
review.name: Bomb Dot Com
comment: Great review. Coming from the 7idp Sam Hills, I?m torn between getting those again or trying these. Can you give a more detailed comparison between the two? Especially regarding breathability and pedal friendliness. Im also worried about them getting gross since u can?t remove the pads to wash

review.reviewBody: So I took these out for a ride and the rubbed against the back of knee the whole ride, not very comfortable. There were abrasions after the ride, so I had to send them back.
review.name: Rubs Back of Knee

review.reviewBody: These knee pads are awesome, I strongly recommend them to anyone looking for lightweight knee pads! They are the perfect balance between lightweight and protective,  they have POC's VPD padding instead of a hard plastic shell over the knee, which allows them to be lightweight and flexible without sacrificing protection.  I have been on numerous rides with them, have fallen and no issues with them sliding around and definitely do their job protecting my knees from cuts, scrapes, and everything else.  The sleeve material is so comfortable that you barely notice that you are wearing them!
review.name: Favorite Knee Pads To Date!
comment: Would you wear these in a bike park or heavy enduro-type rides?  Looking to replace my VPD system knee pads and have POCs lightweight pad with the plastic knee cover for lighter trail riding but need something a bit more robust for park and enduro.

name: Oseus Vpd Knee Pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these bags for a motorcycle trip, to protect important items in the event of rain. It didn’t rain but I was comfortable knowing my items would be protected. Great quality.
review.name: Solid Bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My wife and I purchased several different sizes of dry bags and we use them constantly. They are great for day trips and multi day float trips!
review.name: Multiple dry bags work great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The buckle broke on the 1st day of a 16 day raft trip. A total hassle.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used to use bear-proof bags for backpacking, but quickly realized waterproof was more important when my food was 12ft up in a tree. The sea to summit lightweight dry bag is perfect for this, even has a small loop for your PCT hang!
review.name: better than the rest

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ideal protection for phones, cameras, and other gadgets when the weather fools you. 

Light, tight, efficient.
review.name: Ideal protection when the weather fools you

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bag itself is great, I have no issues with it. I do take issue with the packaging though, the way the bag is packed into the cardboard causes the top of the dry bag to have a heavy fold in it that's impossible to remove. I really wish this was fixed, I bought 2 dry bags of various sizes and both have a huge bend in the top. Other than that, the bag is perfect.
review.name: Dry bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality bag and works the way in intended. I'm using the bag in the opposite way intended keeping the water inside the bag. I have a six pack cooler that holds ice inside the drybag and stored in my motorcycle panniers. This bag a never failed me keeping the other contents of my panniers dry.
review.name: Great quality bag and works

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The company name caught my eye as it reminds me of my local trek from coast to Castle Rock via Big Basin in the Santa Cruz mountains of CA USA. I enjoy hiking and mostly biking on plentiful overland routes. The 1.5L size bag has worked well for my biking toolkits where each color is used for the different kits that I ride with in the rear of my Gore-Tex jerseys. One kit includes 2x tubes (MTB or Gravel or Road) and CO2 carts and tire patches and levers, and others include appropriate tools. Very convenient to simply slip 2x kits needed for whichever bike into the back jersey pockets. Color coded and water resistant. I like the thickness and inside coating. Recommended for compartmentalized back packs too where the assortment of colors and features really work well.
review.name: Excellent Design and Quality 1.5L bags

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As usual Sea to Summit items are top notch.
I messed around with cheap dry bags and decided to try what Sea to Summit had. Not...even....close....bud!
These bags clearly seal better and are higher quality in every way. All while being a very lightweight bag
review.name: As usual Sea to Summit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using the 8 liter version of the lightweight dry bag for around 6 months and I love it! I have used it on multi-day river trips, on backpacking trips and for hike in hot springs outings. A few of my favorite uses of the bag is for storage of dry foods, dry backup clothing layers and dry copies of maps and permits. The bag has proven to be very durable and can be easily hung in a tree for use as a bear bag. I will be purchasing more of these bags.
review.name: I have been using the

name: Lightweight Dry Bag

hasVariant.name: SpotLite 200 Headlamp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond SpotLite 200 Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have never found a better headlamp but it won't take an endless beating and isnt waterproof.  It will hold up against water better than most headlamps but it will fail eventually. Love the compact size plus battery life.
review.name: Durability issues but still a great headlamp

review.reviewBody: These headlamps are convenient for a variety of uses. I have several that I use for hunting and early morning fishing. I bought this one for my wife to use and she loves it.
review.name: Great little light

review.reviewBody: friggin sick headlamp to use on the river or climbing

Easy to operate.
Comfortable.
Bright.
Lightweight.

That's about all I could ask from a headlamp and the Spot delivered on all counts.
review.name: Lot Light in a Little Package

review.reviewBody:
I love this little headlamp. I have another BD headlamp that was 350lumens I think, and probably 50% larger as well. This thing is just so small and low profile. 

The lock function is brilliant. And the separate button to engage the red light? Also brilliant. So nice not having to tap, tap, tap your way to different functions. 

The only thing I would love to see is a slight extension of the part of the lamp that sits on your forehead, something for you to just rest a fingertip on so that tilting the lamp is easier. As it is now, it's a little bit clumsy trying to change the angle of the lamp. 

Great product. I'll probably be buying a few more just to have.
review.name: A great lamp!

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these to keep in my cars in case of an emergency. However, they are light, bright and fully functioned. I may use this as my new backpacking headlamp instead. I especially like that they include the red light function.
review.name: Inexpensive, lightweight and bright

review.reviewBody: I have not used this heavily in the field yet, but I will.  I have been using it mostly for reading in bed while my spouse sleeps.  Overall, I am pleased with the product.  I have been an exclusively Petzl headlamp user for 20+ years.  This was my first purchase of a BD headlamp (though I have been using BD climbing pro for 25+ years).  I like the features and the hold to dim.  This is not rechargeable but that can be an advantage in many scenarios.  It's light and I will continue to use it as lighter weight primary headlamp when in the field.  Easily switches to red light.
review.name: Excellent Headlamp

review.reviewBody: Easy to use headlamp. No more fiddling with button patterns to find the red light nightmode. I pack my Spot Lite with me on every backpacking excursion. This headlamp is small, durable, and has exceptional battery life. Great product.
review.name: Light of my hike

review.reviewBody: This light is awesome. Its light weight and the 200 lumens will surprise you. This is great for dark runs. Light weight so it virtually doesn't move. Its also small enough to put in a pocket and only uses two AAA. Battery life is okay.
review.name: Best bang for the $$$

review.reviewBody:
I think we are now up to owning five of these Spot Lite 200's for our family of four and planning to order four more soon.

These offer plenty of light for trail hiking and backcountry camping. The red light probably gets the most use in camp and around the house for tasks such as checking on our young boys in bed late at night or reading in bed without disturbing my wife.

This is one of those items that you'll want to have within reach in your backpack, car, kitchen, bedroom, garage, etc. It makes simple tasks that much easier.

The lights pair perfectly with Pale Blue Earth rechargeable AAA batteries.
review.name: Perfect head light

name: SpotLite 200 Headlamp
SpotLite 200 Headlamp

Buy the KEEN Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of the mens low top version. Unfortunately they just didn’t hold up for daily use. After a year the outsole started to separate and the area around the flex rubber started to separate. This made the waterproofing pointless. I usually buy hiking shoes for daily use because they hold up longer and are more comfortable but that was not the case with theses. I would recommend staying away from the flex style boot.
review.name: Disappointing quality

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my 3nd pair. It is the only boot that holds my heel in place. Most boots will not hold a women's heel. But since this boot holds your heel. It is hard to get on. The solution is a shoe horn. My podiatrist loved the boot because it has great ankle support
review.name: It has great heel holding

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These boots are very light and comfortable with good arch support. I went up1/2 size and wish I didn’t as after 4 miles there was some rubbing. Glad I had a band-aide for the 4 miles back. I will tie them tighter and wear thicker socks. I like the flex feature across the top of the foot and that there are truly waterproof. Hiking the Annapurna Circuit this fall and think these will be perfect.
I bought the Terradora Flex also, while these are specifically designed for women, they were not as comfortable as the Timberwolf Flex. No arch support.
review.name: Good Ones

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable on your feet and look good. My second pair.
review.name: Excellent! Boot

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am an electrician by trade and these are my second pair of Keens. These boots are comfortable and never really seemed stiff to work in. I am on my feet walking and climbing ladders, under houses, and in attic spaces. I never worry about slipping or lack of traction which is vital in this field. I still have my first pair and bought new inserts for them to use around the yard, hiking, and as a back up pair. I am hooked on Keens for work and pleasure!
review.name: Comfortable and Functional

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I've learned that a great boot is imperative in the field- it can make or break your hike. I've destroyed countless pairs of boots in a matter of a few months- before i got a pair of keens. They are the only pair of boots that can withstand the outdoors. I recommend keens to all of my biologist friends. perfectly waterproof, the flex seems to be a key factor in how these boots survive constant bending. and, they are PFAS free! 
I have a pair of keen sandals and boots in 8 & 1/2 (US) and i ordered the same size in these and they ran pretty large. had to send them back for an 8 and possibly could have gone with a 7 & 1/2 even. these run large for some reason.
review.name: a field biologist's best friend

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I do trail hikes twice a week in average throughout the year. Definitely they keep my feet dry in rain or in snow. Could get a bit too hot in the summer months, but never caused a single blister from a get go. I didn't realize a wide shoes can be this comfortable! I am pretty sure I'll be buying these boots for as long as I can hike!
review.name: All season boots

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are definitely sturdy and seem to be made with good material. The problem is that the supports built into the boots are VERY uncomfortable. After walking around in them for just 5 minutes, the supports in the outer ankle area were hitting my ankle bone so much that they hurt. They fit just fine, true to size. Maybe my height (5'4"), weight (130 lbs), and ankle shape just didn't work well with this design. But I was very disappointed, knowing there was no way I could hike in these. I'm returning them today and looking at other brands for the right hiking boots for me.
review.name: VERY uncomfortable on my ankles

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The tongue of these boots is designed so that when the boots are tied, the tongue’s attachment fabric rubs against the front ankle joint. I took them out for a short hike, but didn’t even leave the parking lot. After several adjustments failed, I took them off and put on my old boots.
review.name: Unwearable

review.itemreviewed: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm even tho technically not insulated. Great for all seasons—even winter when snow is not too deep. Love that there is room to wiggle the toes! This my 2nd pair and the first lasted for many years and untold miles of hikes. They were still waterproof but were just losing tread. I have NEVER gotten wet feet in these boots! ❤️
review.name: Warm even tho technically not

name: Ridge Flex Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
