review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: way too small
review.name: buyer

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Breathable, nice fabric. But does not do good in hot weather
review.name: Good castelli jersey

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought 3 of these in size L. I have a number of the Attacco Limited Edition Jerseys in size Large as well and this is a bit more roomier and heavier fabric. I think it's not great for hot weather, it doesn't seem to breathe as well as the Attacco. I will be using these for colder days on the trainer as it's a bit heavier and looser than my other jerseys. The fabric and the pattern are great! High quality.
review.name: Great Training Jersey

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: As stated sizes run very small.  I ordered one size up and it wasn't even close to fitting.  I will return and try another size.
review.name: Flusso full zip jersey

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: With Pearl Izumi jerseys, an XL fits me perfectly; I ordered this in 2XL and it's still too tight to wear.  I would advise going up 2 sizes when ordering.
review.name: Runs VERY small.

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a nice jersey overall.  Good material and well made, but not a true hot weather jersey.  I bought an XL whcih is comfortable and more of a casual fit, whereby I can fit a couple base layers underneath comfortably.  A large would have been more of a race fit, but likely still reasonably comfortable.
review.name: Nice Jersey - Not for very hot weather

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 6'5/245 and this jersey barely fit.  I'm looking forward to losing some of my covid-19lbs so it fits better.  I would absolutely say this jersey fits small.  I initially ordered a XXL and it was super-tight.  I understand race-tight, but I was borderline inappropriate wearing it.  I got some Castelli bib shorts as well and needed to exchange for 3XL as well.  This was my first Castelli purchase and I'm discovering that just about everything they sell runs small - even gloves and socks which I ordered as well.  Overall very happy with the style though.
review.name: 3XL was almost too small

review.itemreviewed: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love the fit and feel of my new jersey. I worn it several times on the road since I got it 2 weeks ago. The pocket placement is great. My only disappointment is the color. I bought chartreuse thinking it would be a very bright yellow as it looks online but it is more of an olive color and not as high vis as I wanted. I am more of a chubby female rider. Last year I bought a Castelli jersey 3XL (pass or fluoso I think) and it fit perfectly (snug) but this jersey has a lot more room. Still a good jersey.
review.name: Almost Perfect

name: Flusso Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for a family member who is an avid outdoorsman and he really likes it! Great for shooting or hunting events
review.name: Great Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shirt is of wonderful design. Though it is loose fit for me but I love this fitiing.
review.name: eyecatching design!

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: No padding in shoulder.  Only a piece of different fabric
review.name: Not as expected
comment: We are sorry to hear the item did not meet your expectations . We take all feedback into consideration and will do our best to improve this opportunity in the future.

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shirt looks great, but fails where it counts.  It’s a nice light shirt for hot weather, we’ll ventilated.  However, I bought this shirt specifically for extra padding in the shoulder and was very disappointed when it arrived and found that the patch over the shoulder feels lighter than the shirt material itself.  I returned the shirt without even trying it on.
review.name: Disappointed!

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shirt is very confortable and fit well.  However I expected a bit more padding in the right shoulder. It does not add the needed comfort for shooting.  I also found that the neck stained easily and would not come clean completely.  Fortunately, it will only be worn for hunting.
review.name: Attractive Shirt, But Poor Performer.

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I own 2 of these shirts and will purchase again. Very comfortable to wear and wicks off moisture. Great early season upland shirt and looks good enough to wear to dinner.
review.name: Blood and Guts Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am enjoying my Blood and Guts shooting shirts, they are loaded with great features. The shirts are made of soft ,freely mobile , breathable material that is UPF rated for sun blockade. Machine Washable material Sizing is true to measurements.
 My favorite colors are green and beiges. They run true to size, with a flexible pane in the back for added range of motion of the upper extremity when hunting or clay target sports. I particularly enjoy the butt plate pad on the right shoulder. It works well as a non slip surface with minimal increase in the length of pull (does not add length to the gun). 
One of the neatest aspects of the shirt are the loops that can connect to just above the elbows and allow one to roll up the sleeves and hold them in an elevated position. The buttons are very durable and distinctive.
review.name: Blood and Guts Shooting and Hunting Shirts

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent product love the function
review.name: Love itt

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shirt is a great addition to your shooting and upland hunting clothing collection. It is breathable and is actually quite warm when paired with a polypropylene or silk undershirt. My only complaint was that there is no padding in the shoulder area for recoil abatement. Overall though it is a great product like you would expect from Columbia.
review.name: Blood and guts shooting shirt

review.itemreviewed: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good Quality shirt that fits like it should and looks great
review.name: Great Shirt

name: Blood and Guts Shooting Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: I LOVE THIS JACKET.  Super toasty and love the hood.  Men's coat (I'm female) so I got a medium and it fits perfect. Cotopaxi rules!
review.name: awesome jacket

review.reviewBody: This product I purchased was small size for me, it kept me warm and comfortable when I wear it every time
review.name: This product I purchased was

review.reviewBody: Jacket runs really big and cut is very boxy. Website pictures made it look like there was a foldable hood but hood is fully exposed and does not tuck into collar. Had to return.
review.name: Not great

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for a trip to park city. It kept me VERY warm. So much so that I was fine walking around outside in the snow with just a t-shirt underneath. The fit is great. I bought a size too large and the exchange process was easy.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody:
My husband got a Solazo Down Hooded Jacket for Christmas. He looks so good in it. Every time I see him in it, I want to go on an adventure. We live in a cold place and the jacket makes it seem warm and comfortable. It's truly awesome. 
A few years ago, I bought my son the same jacket, just different colors. He is crazy on his clothes, but the little holes he's gotten in his coat seem to heal themselves. All except one, it leaks out little white feathers, but he sewed it himself and it works great.
review.name: SO warm, nice looking!

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with the quality. Shipping could be a lot faster. Will be back!
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Have purchased many down products from various companies over the years and feel that the quality and price can't be beat. It does run a bit small across the shoulders. Usually wear a men's small but sized up to the medium.
review.name: Mens Puffy

review.reviewBody: I go to school in Rexburg which is close to Yellowstone, so it is pretty cold here. I usually need two coats but wearing this is all I need.
review.name: Warmest Coat Ever Warn

review.reviewBody: I really love this jacket. It's just a big, light, poofy hug. The colors are tasteful, and it feels very soft to the touch. I like the adjustment around the waist, but I do find the wrists a tad loose, so if I'm not wearing gloves, cold air will creep under the jacket. It's also the kind of thing that really benefits from an outer shell to protect against the wind, but all in all, I'm very happy with the warmth and comfort it proves.
review.name: Big, airy hug

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket for our friend's birthday gift. He loves it, it's well made, fits nicely, light weight, warm and this is his first jacket he enjoys wearing in cold weather
review.name: Nice!!!

name: Solazo Hooded Down Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: It's a great, durable piece of kit that will stand up to anything you throw at it. The vents are easy to open and close, even with gloves on. The suspenders stay up and supportive. The cuffs stand up to sharp edges and running boards of snowmobiles. Has great pockets with pockets within for phone storage. I really like that the trim inside the pockets is orange so you can see that they are open and don't fill them with snow. Glad to see a product still being made with Pro so I can last longer than a single season.
review.name: Tough but functional

review.itemreviewed: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect fit except the top was too tight with no way to adjust.  Top has elastic but there is almost no stretch.  Only one side zipper goes to the top the other side zipper is just a vent.  Lowering the bib straps made it ride lower but even more baggy in the legs.  Just not a good design for high end pants. Expected better for the price.
review.name: Too tight in chest

review.itemreviewed: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic Bib. Probably best on the market. I have been using it for both patrolling and free skiing. Waterproofing is great never failed me. The bottom of the pant is scratch resistant. Been skiing hard on them and there's not a single scratch. Only flaw I've found is the beacon pocket is a little sticky so it takes a few seconds to pull the beacon out.

review.itemreviewed: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've skied in these 3 times so far this season and they've performed spectacularly. It's been hard for me to find ski pants that come in a long size so I've also particularly enjoyed that. The pants offer excellent water/snow protection and has great ventilation on both sides. It's also nice there is an fly in the front for easy access but like most bibs sitting down to use the bathroom isn't the best. The insulated phone pocket has also been a game changer with the my old iPhone lasting noticeably longer than in past seasons.
review.name: Very high performing ski bottoms

review.itemreviewed: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Some excellent design features with lots of great pockets and a high quality construction

name: Eiger Free Pro HS Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice shorts with matching belt included. Loved all of the pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sized right.  Comfortable.  Light weight.  Great when on sale.  Not a fan of velcro close back pockets but these aren't bad.  Zippered pocket a must.
review.name: Nice shorts.

review.reviewBody: Size is way off on the shorts and returns are overly complex and slow.
review.name: Terrible sizing
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Material awesome.  Comfort awesome.  Fit awesome.  Just plain AWESOME
review.name: Best shorts ever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these for my son who has other Columbia shorts he bought. I brought the exact same size in two different styles, but the Silver Ridge Style ran small. It is not a true 32 waist. I would suggest going up a size.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well made, comfortable, fit perfect, roomy secure pockets.
review.name: Great shorts
Like No Pants, Only Better!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband loves these shorts they are comfortable and if he makes a spontaneous to decision to go swimming he can because they are quick dry, and dont shrink
review.name: Silver Ridge Cargo Shorts

review.reviewBody: Pants are fine, but the color is not what I was expecting.  Ordered Fossil, which is what I received.  The picture online is much closer to white than the tan color I received. Are the pictures for Fossil and Tusk backwards?
review.name: Color not as shown

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in November for my husband to have this summer. They are the same size he has of the same exact shorts in 2 other colors that he has had for years. He went to put them on for the first time today and they don't fit the same. Very frustrating.
review.name: Don't fit the same as before.
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback!

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great additional to all the other Hydro Flask bottles I have. I just wish that you were able to put hot liquids in it as well.
review.name: Perfect In Between Size.

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Timely arrival. Very nice looking product. Also I appreciate the extra straws.
review.name: Timely arrival. Very nice looking

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought it for my mom, she loves the size and the weight is easy for her to use when full. Now my girlfriend wants one, she loves the size for her smaller hands.
review.name: Kids size can be the way to go as an adult

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have bought so many of these for all of my children. New model is not as nice. Holds less water, thinner, and silicone sleeve on bottom no longer softens the slam noise when setting your bottle onto a table or other surface. Even my four year old noticed and was asking for her old bottle back. Overall, just seems cheaper. Not a fan. Go back to previous model and you will have a customer again.
review.name: Previous model was better

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Come on, Hydroflask. Why ruin a good thing? I have purchased these bottles for all my children for years. They are now smaller (hold less water), thinner, and the silicone sleeve on the bottom no longer softens the slam noise on the counter. It just seems cheaply made. Go back to previous model and you will have a customer from me.
review.name: Previous model was better

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Smaller than previous kids design, and my son doesn’t really like the color options.
review.name: Smaller than previous kids version

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: The Hydro Flask 18 oz Kids Wide Mouth with Straw Cap is perfect for active kids. It’s durable, keeps drinks cold for hours, and the spill-proof straw cap is easy to use. The size is ideal for little hands, and the fun colors add appeal. While it’s a bit pricey and the straw needs careful cleaning, the quality and functionality make it worth it. A great choice for school, sports, or adventures!
review.name: Best water bottle for Little hands

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this kids green water bottle for my everyday coffee, I switched the lid out. I got it engraved with my last name. I love it!! Great deal getting the kids size and comes with the bootie. I wanted 18oz or 20oz and one that I could engrave, not everything has the engraving option.
review.name: Green water bottle

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We’ve own many smaller sizes for our kids. It was time to upgrade to a bigger size since now she’s more active and drinking more from it at school. She loves the color and with her engraved name on it.
review.name: 18 oz kids wide mouth

review.itemreviewed: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my sisters to use at school and they are PERFECT! Grippy bottom to keep on their desk, straw for easy sipping all day.
review.name: 2 cool 4 school

name: 18oz Wide Mouth Flex Straw & Boot - Kids'

review.reviewBody: My second set. These tires are a great all around tires. Puncture resistant, only had one flat on my first set due to those street sweepers wire.
review.name: Gatorskins

review.reviewBody: I've ridden across the US and the UK on these tires without ONE flat. I wouldn't install any other tire on my road bikes if I'm riding significant road miles or touring. Yorktown VA to San Francisco - 4096 miles - not one flat. John O'Groats to Lands End - 1100 miles - not one flat. German Engineering and Manufacturing - can't be beaten. Don't buy any other road tire if you want peace of mind against flats.
review.name: THE best tire to prevent flats - PERIOD.

review.reviewBody: I bought these because I kept having flats. I love these and not a flat yet.
review.name: Not a flat yet. Easy to put on

review.reviewBody: I don't know what happened to all you people that are complaining. Maybe you just didn't install the tire correctly?? I've ridden 15,000 miles on three different pairs of these tires and I've had three flats two of which were my fault. I even ride these on gravel roads and never had a puncture.
review.name: Indestructible

review.reviewBody: A good set of tires for my daily bike, very solid for rough roads or uneven pavement.
review.name: Good Tires

review.reviewBody:
The Conti Gatorskin has been my go to tire for a few years now, before that I tried several different tires and never got the miles, performance and (smooth) ride I get on these. 
I ride 700*23 (@ 115psi) upfront and 700*25 (@ 95psi) in the rear. I run this set up on both my "A" (summer) bike and my Winter bike. I watch other riders change flats ( running on "cheap" tires) all year long. 
Some people say these tires a too hard to mount onto their rims. The tires are a bit tuff to get on the 1st time, I have Enve SES 4.5 and Campy Alloy wheels, but I can do it without tire levers (although my thumbs are a bit sore afterwards) if necessary. 
I no long race, I do however ride about 9,000 to 10,000 miles a year. And ALL those miles on Conti Gatorskins!
review.name: Best tire for NY & Other Crappy roads
comment: Seriously? I have hundreds of miles on these with no issues, no flats.  Makes me think there was some user error.

review.reviewBody:
I used to ride with the Grand Prix 4000 tires, but I have switched to have this tire on both of my road bikes after too many tire slashes from glass/shell/metal, etc.. Riding in Florida where there's a lot of debris on the roads, these tires are tough enough to handle those obstacles without ruining your ride. I've seen them get slashed deep and still not get through to the tube.
They are heavier and not as fast, but worth the trade off if you find yourself replacing tires often.
review.name: Beefy tire for rough roads
comment: Great review. Thank you!!!

review.reviewBody: I had these tires for less that six months and after a second flat, I discovered a slashed on the wall side, which I fixed with a patch to make back home. The quality is not as advertised for puncture resistance.
review.name: Tire Quality
comment: Had the exact same cut in my tyre. But saying that, I still wood purchase gator skins. We have a small group of riders, (average age 70) and everyone rides on gator skins.

review.reviewBody: I have used these tires for less than six months and the rear tire wall side gave up with a slash and cuts on the Mai surface
review.name: Tire Quality

review.reviewBody: After years of not wanting to sacrifice performance for durability , this winter I gave in and replaced my Vitorria Corsa G' s ( an outstanding tire ) with a pair of Gatorskins. After coming home from rides with another cut or two every time out from the ice melt material on Pennsylvania roads. I was surprised to find that the performance drop off was not noticeable . They feel great and are STRONG.  The shoulders of roads where most of the ice melt debris winds up had no effect on the Gatorskins. After about a thousand miles, one small cut, no flats !  The cut could have been from glass which is an increasing problem as the the pickup truck driving set seems to be having trouble reaching the weeds when throwing there empty cheap vodka bottles out the window and breaking them on the shoulder . GREAT TIRES !
review.name: Great tire for winter roads !
comment: What does a 700 equate to? My rim size is 26x1.5

name: Gatorskin Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the absolute BEST flannel shirts available; I expect them to last for years. Especially this item. Layer up or single out.. this has me covered.. ??

review.itemreviewed: Rugged Flex Relaxed Fit MW Flannel LS Plaid Shirt - Men's

It's true, when other clothing items breakdown, carhartt just starts to break-in. Another bonus, I am able to get away with wearing this shirt and carhartt vest on a cold day, versus having to wear a bulky jacket, which restricts mobility ... good quality shirt and am sure I will have for the years to come

description: Buy the Mammut Albula HS Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Albula HS Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Albula HS Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Its so rare to find short rain pants, let alone a pair that is both flattering and waterproof! I've used these through the winter on vancouver island, they've kept me dry in downpours and pack small to carry just in case. I love that they have both the fly button and full side zips. The sizing is a little big - I usually wear size 4 or 6 and went 36 (6 equivalent), they're big enough for layers underneath.

I wore these during the Michigan Ice Fest while climbing.  These were very comfortable and were able to bend and stretch with ease.  The length was good - I'm 5'10 with a 36" inseam.  These stopped at the top of my boots but my socks and gaiters kept my ankles warm. These were excellent at blocking the wind.  I was able to wear these over a base layer and insulated leggings layer.  The only unfortunate part was that the waist was a bit big and poofy.  I didn't exchange for a lower size in case they would be too short or too tight in the leg and I didn't want to lose that comfort.  But I might have them taken in a bit.  I still highly recommend.
review.name: Right length, wrong waist

review.reviewBody:
I did not have very good luck with these pants. The fit was quite off. They fit through the legs but were seriously gaping at the waist. I tried to find  way to tighten them but there are no buttons, velcro, or belt loops to be able to cinch the waist.

I wore them out on a multi-day hike and the very thin material ripped in two spots on different occasions.

name: Albula HS Pant - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Joint VPD 2.0 Long Knee Pads online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These fit super small. I have a pair of POC Joint VPD 2.0 in size XL (they also fit small and I had to size up). I bought the long version in XL and they fit even smaller. I could barely get them on my leg and couldn’t get them up high enough. 

The regular version (not these long ones) seem of good quality and run very hot.
review.name: Good quality but questionable fit

review.reviewBody:
I ride in so-cal dry shale and rocks ..and love the downhills and little jumps and kickers ......knee pads are critical. This is my second pair of these pads . My old ones are over 10 years old and the Velcro straps are stretched out and have lost their griping / sticking power. But still stayed up pretty darn well . I still use them in my snowboard kit  . 
This new pair feel a bit tighter and the top strap is thicker and stronger .  Many people have commented that they run small. I would say that they start out a bit tight but because the material forms to your body slowly I have no problem wearing these for my 2-3 hour  local rides . I do sometimes push them down while climbing or leave them in my pack till I get to the top or the sketchy downhills. 
As far as crash protection , these are the absolute best. !  I crashed my knee on a railroad tie recently and these pads saved me.
Also the outer material is somehow rip proof .
My old pair has been crashed on so many times and still has no rips . 
Another thing is how nice these are to kneel down on while doing any trail side maintenance ! Yeah, they are expensive but your knees are worth it !
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: I followed the measurement instructions  and ordered a medium but when trying on at home  I could feel it compressing my hamstring just sitting in a chair. Ordered the L and fit better. Only 1 day testing and it stayed up while pedaling and secure in the DH bike park. A lit warm but it?s summer and hot in WV. I?m a wimp and would not be getting air or anything crazy but this seemed like a good idea just in case...
review.name: Runs small

name: Joint VPD 2.0 Long Knee Pads

They are not.  The Nocs website describes them as water resistant and fog proof.  If you were to drop one into a river even for a moment it would be ruined.  I would love it if Backcountry would change the wording in their listing and send a new monocular for my wonderful girlfriend.   We promise to be more careful with them in the future.

review.reviewBody:
First off - it's frustrating trying to find matching pairs in right colors + the correct sizes. The availability issue happens often regardless of online store. 

Having done XT and XTR rotors previously, I would place these particular Hope somewhere in between. They performed roughly close to XT but not as good as XTR. I had noticeable brake fade and they were very sensitive to any sort of contamination. Found myself having to clean them and check my pads often. Upgrading pads and calipers helped some.
review.name: A bit underwhelmed

review.reviewBody: Never received though got an email saying it was delivered. Reached out to customer service but never got a response. After the silence I ended up buying from a competitor at a competitive price.
review.name: Never Received
comment:
Hello,
We are very sorry to hear you never received the order. We have sent you an email to help you resolve this issue. We look forward to hearing from you!

review.reviewBody:
These look great but, according to LBS, they are made specifically for Hope brakes.  Due to the prominence of the bolt that attaches the two pieces of the rotor, these rotors can rub on the actual brake body of many brakes, sram code in this case.
This should probably be noted in the item description.
review.name: Nice but...

review.reviewBody: These were super easy to install. They work great and they look amazing. Would recommend!
review.name: Looks sendy

name: Floating Disc Rotor

review.reviewBody:
The materials this was made out of seemed pretty decent quality. It has a YKK Vislon zipper, the ripstop material seems very sturdy and thick.

However, this brand has the strangest fit. I am in between a Medium and Large for pretty much every brand. I ordered a Medium on this because you want a windbreaker to be more snug. However, this thing fit like I was wearing a 45-gallon trash bag. It was super baggy and strange looking.

I bought another item from this brand that also fits strange, but was much cheaper and I like a bit better so am keeping it. However, this windbreaker is going back. I got it on sale for $38 and don't even think it is worth that. I just don't think I could bare to be seen in public wearing this.

It definitely does not fit like a windbreaker for active activities. It is more of a city-design, however it is just like a strange thin parka. Skip this.

PS: You can't even find any info on this brand. Why don't they have a simple website? Even mom&pop stores have websites.
review.name: What a weird fit!

name: Ripstop Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I usually wear a size 11, but I had to order 3 of these and the 12 (11.75) is still a little small. They are narrow too, which is amazing for me because I have narrow feet, but for normal feet these are going to be too small in every dimension, definitely order a full size larger than normal.

Other than that, the sole is fantastic for flat pedals, it's great for walking around town, and the show is nice and comfortable for everyday use. It's a little on the warmer side, but it breathes well (the shoe has some nice padding). The white gets dirty immediately, but it looks good dirty (maybe it's just me but I like a dirty white canvas sneaker).
review.name: Great Shoe, but definitely runs small

name: 2FO Method Mountain Bike Shoe

review.reviewBody: I tried multiple times, attempted to purchase the right size, failed every time. The charts do not help. Wasting time, efforts, and return shipping fees. Very frustrating.
review.name: Difficult to purchase the right size.

author.name: Did not end up with one

review.reviewBody: Wow, I was floored by these shoes. I've been climbing for more than 2 decades and in that time I've worn hundreds of shoes. These babies beat them all! Slip your little piggies into the fronts, yard on the back like they will never fit, and woop, you're in and they are comfy. (Buy your street shoe size.) They stick, have plenty of feeling for those dime edges, and you can wear them for a full session without removal. My only regret is that I didn't buy every pair available in my size. I just had some fancy pants scarpas and hands down, these shoes are way better.
review.name: Ocun is my new go to shoe

name: Ozone Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Got this 2 weeks ago and very happy with it. Have to use for work because we are above 6 feet and working. Great comfort and light on your head.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
There is no better helmet than the one you wear, this one is so light (just under 9 ounces for the Large) and comfortable you can wear it all-day and barely notice it is on your head.

I was slightly nervous about the lack of an attachment point or strap for a headlamp but have had no issues with the headlamp coming off.

#BackcountryGearhead
review.name: Great, Light Climbing helmet

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this helmet! I hardly notice it on my head and never notice it in the gear bag on the approach.  It's very secure on my head and I haven't had the issue of a headlamp tilting it forward.  Even on long days (18+ hours with the helmet on) it remains comfortable.
review.name: Light and comfortable

name: Storm Helmet

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Jackson Ridge Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Jackson Ridge Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Jackson Ridge Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great fashionable light jacket. Fits a little boxy
review.name: Fashion item

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I'm 5'4" and 135 lbs, 35" around the chest and ordered the small. I often size up in jackets for layering but didn't need to with this one. In fact, there's even a lot of extra room with the small so I'd say it's oversized, but it does fit me like the photos of the models. It's a rugged material but not too stiff. It's perfect for chilly days in the fall and spring.
review.name: New favorite fall & spring jacket

review.reviewBody: Super warm, layerable, and in the style I was after. I was a bit skeptical at the oversize fit but it’s actually pretty flattering. I’m mostly going to wear this as an around the beach and light hiking, and the mix of fleece and canvas is perfect so far, blocking the wind but not too heavy on days when the sun hits just so.
review.name: Great for windy beach days

review.reviewBody: Returned because the shoulders fit super weird, a bit disappointed because I was so looking forward to this jacket.  Thankfully MTH made returns super easy, kudos for that
review.name: Weird fit

review.reviewBody: Ordered med & lg I’m usually an lg. Large was to long in arms & baggy in shoulders. Loved the length. Kept med because it felt more my size. Wish it was a lil longer. The weight of jacket is great! Not overly warm so you can move in, but does offer protection from elements.
review.name: Great quality jacket very functional

review.reviewBody: LOVE. It's the perfect in-between jacket (which is sometimes all I need for winter). I was immediately drawn to the Clay Earth color, but realized this is just a perfect jacket. It's warm enough, stylish enough, rugged enough. I would typically wear a M but opted for a L for an oversized fit for sweaters or other bulky layers.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: Needing a moveable, wearable, light canvas-style jacket for all things mountain living: removing slash, walking through burrs, tree work, etc. I love the relaxed fit of Mountain Hardware jackets so I took a gamble and tried this over Carhartt. Couldn't be happier. It's so comfortable, made well and the fuzzy lining is so cozy. Can't rave enough! Size 14 pants, large bust and the XL fits nice and relaxed with plenty of space to swing an axe, carry trees, or take the dog for a walk with a thick sweater underneath. One of those "may buy two in different colors" kind of product love!
review.name: Great product

name: Jackson Ridge Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excellent product and timely delivery. I recommend it.
review.name: Thule kit 5140

review.reviewBody: Will they do it again?   The roof rack was very difficult to attach to my Prius v.  Thule makes it difficult by creating instructions that are too general and not specific to the kit given.   Thus, unless you have done it before, it will take lots of time to figure out very simple stuff.   So, my advice--lay out everything and make certain it's in the right order.   I took apart my racks three times before all the pieces were correctly placed.   Also, make certain the decorative caps are snapped in as two of mine blew off and now the rack looks even more poorly designed.
review.name: Thule Rejected My Last Review
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule FitKit 145129.
According to our moderation records, your prior review was removed for violating community standards for generally inappropriate langauge.
Thule roof rack systems include vehicle-specific mounting instructions to ensure the specially-designed FitKit attaches to the correct and most supportive area of the vehicle. This process may be more involved than more general roof rack fits to ensure a strong hold. A second person makes this process much easier as they can help position the crossbars and ensure they do not move while tightening in place. 
If installation assistance is needed, Thule Customer Support is available Monday-Friday, 8:30 am - 5:30 pm EST for questions and guidance. 
https://help.thule.com/s/contactsupport?language=en_US

review.reviewBody: A must have for installing the Thule Hallavator Pro kayak rack on our roof rack!
review.name: A must have!

review.reviewBody: The product was easy to install and ver good quality.
review.name: Thule Roof Rack

review.reviewBody: Exactly as advertised, arrived quickly. Little pricey but alternative options aren't much better on price. Stock with what you know is good
review.name: Anchor kit

review.reviewBody: This clamp kit fits my 2019 F150 Supercab perfectly.  Very solid and secure.
review.name: Solid connection

review.reviewBody: I purchased this two weeks ago and know that I made a great choice based on much research. Thule delivered as only Thule can. Once you understand how everything fits together, it goes on in a snap. Snug fitting and does a great job of transporting my kayak. Would highly recommend it to anyone.
review.name: Super-Easy Install. Looks great

review.reviewBody: We purchased the base kit and WingBar Evo for our Honda HR-V 2WD LX to mount the Thule cargo box for our travels. The base kit was a perfect fit. Using the instructions provided the installation was straightforward and was completed in less than an hour. We now have a solid base for our cargo box. Next stop - the Great Lakes and eastern seaboard!
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: This was the only mounting kit I was able to find that fit my VW.  Trouble free installation and perfect fit.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: great product, fits very nicely on the Jetta. Although, during heavey rain storms. some doors have a minor drip caused by the clamps. overall, i think its great.
review.name: Great product thats fits the 2016 Jetta

name: EVO Fit Kit- 2 Pair

hasVariant.name: Escapist Tarp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Escapist Tarp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We used this while canoeing in the Boundary Waters. It was easy to set up and provided good protection from wind and rain. The sides can be adjusted using the guy lines depending on how mush coverage is needed
review.name: Lightweight easy to use tarp

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a hike on the West Coast Trail on Vancouver Island. Used on the first night as a second fly above the tent during a huge rainstorm. Then used it as a primary shelter on the beach with my poles. Found it light, quick drying and not terribly bulky. It is about the size of a nalgene bottle rolled up. The material is thin but it didn't feel fragile. Would recommend.
review.name: Light supplemental tarp

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using this tarp for nearly a decade and I absolutely love it. I have the large size with the inner tent and it’s incredibly spacious and lightweight. I’ve used it in just about every condition you could imagine and it’s held up exceptionally well. I’ve survived big summer storms in the alpine, used it in light snow, stayed dry in absolute downpours, and just about anything else you can think of. The 10x10 size feels like a palace when you’re solo and it disappears in your pack. Barely shows any sign of wear. Can’t recommend this tarp enough.
review.name: Lightweight, versatile, durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing pairs perfectly with my UL hammock. Got the L incase I wanna snag the bug tent and footprint. Really happy with it alone so far.
review.name: Perfect UL hammock companion

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used the tarp several nights while hiking the Appalachian Trail as added cover from heavy rains. This tarp rocked and was great. It added a bit of a vestibule cover to the front of the tent and kept us wonderfully dry
review.name: Great Tarp

review.reviewBody: So light that I don’t mind carrying this for group mess tarp when backpacking.
review.name: So light that I don’t

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the larger of the Escapist tarps (10' x 10') a few years ago, and I love it. I have owned a number of tarps over the past 45 years or so, and this one is by far the best I have ever used. The material is very light, strong, and waterproof; the attachment points are very sturdy; and the attached cordage and adjusters are very helpful during setup. The one modification I've made -- and I've done this for every flat tarp I have ever owned -- is to add a center-point pullout. For that I use a small grip clip such as those offered by Shelter Systems. The center point is useful for increasing headroom, especially in poor weather when you want most or all edges low to the ground or even pinned to the ground on the windward side.

I recommend getting the 10'x10' size if you intend to sleep two persons. 

My wife and I use our tarp mostly as a dining fly (for 2 persons), so that we can eat away from our tent in bear country, protected from the weather. In rainy conditions, we may also set up or take down the tent under the tarp but normally use the tent in a separate location.

I normally carry three or four lightweight stakes and two or three ounces of lightweight rope of various lengths (1' to 40') to facilitate more setup options.
review.name: Best tarp I have ever owned

review.reviewBody: Super light…..very easy to use. Great for ultralight backpacking.
review.name: Super light…..very easy to use.

review.reviewBody: Used this tent for the first time bike packing. It is super light and packs smaller than a Nalgene. On the bikepacking trip I wasn’t sure how it would hold up so I brought a bivy to put under but was not necessary. I spent the whole night on top of bivy. From here on out only pad and bag under this and will use instead of tent. Could also be nice if you have a tent to have this elsewhere for a cooking shelter
review.name: Awesome shelter !

review.reviewBody: Great emergency tarp. Multiple setups a plus. Ultra light and durable. Only complaint is the very tight stuff sack. Had to change it out for a little larger one. Goes with me on every day hike in my pack, “just in case”. I am very satisfied overall with Sea to Summit gear.
review.name: Escapist Tarp

name: Escapist Tarp

review.reviewBody: The colors caught my eye. Packs are even better in person. Love that they are sustainable minded/sourced.

review.reviewBody: The packs were a big hit at Christmas. The colors made each one unique and I can’t wait to order more gifts (maybe backpacks!) in the near future!
review.name: Bought one for my each of the young women in my family

review.reviewBody: The bag is pretty small and it’s difficult for me to believe that you can fit 1. 5l. To me it looks like it would be 0. 5l at the most. Sadly it was listed as “final sale” and I will have to donate it as it can’t be returned. I’m also not impressed with the colors I got - some of them look faded.

review.reviewBody: Love the Del Dia Hip Pack. It was last year's model and on sale. Who cares! Glad to finally have a Hip Pack that will work for hiking and going to stadiums - given it's size, it's perfect for both!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and durable past 3 years this boot has been my go too.
review.name: Comfy

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality and comfort! Perfect for hiking in all weather and terrain.
review.name: Quality and Comfort!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boots look great and based on walking the dog in the rain they are definitely water proof. The shoes are true to size, You may want to get a 1/2 size bigger if you always wear thick socks. They are fine with athletic crew socks. The quality is excellent the seams are tight and the bottoms provide secure footing.
review.name: Good quality great looking boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a pair for my hiking in the UK highland area. They are so comfortable with good traction. Excellently built with high quality materials
review.name: High Quality

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my son and he loved them. They are like sneaker mixed with a boot, so not only are waterproof, but also fashionable and he really likes how well they work with his clothes even when it’s not cold. I love the way they look on him and luckily they’re not heavy at all unlike some other pairs of winter boots. He said they don’t make his feet sweat which is also great.
review.name: Very nice shoes

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots use to be nice. I bought them 5 times prior to my most recent purchase. This boot would last me many month before the dread would become low. This time around this boot lasted not even a full month before the tread was completely worn
review.name: Changed up the rubber
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  Please know that we are committed to improvement and if you'd like to discuss your concerns further, please reach out to us directly.

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoes. Looks nice and are very comfortable. True to size
review.name: Perfect shoes

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband wanted these boots for his birthday, to replace the last pair he had. This is the third pair of these boots he has owned. He's tried other brands, but they were not as comfortable. He wears them as his everyday, all purpose, all season shoes, and he walks a lot! They look nice; he receives compliments on them. We're very glad that this model has been continued and hope it will stay around.
review.name: Best-looking comfortable everyday walking boots!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband is on his feet for work all day, so it was wonderful to find a shoe that was actually comfortable for him to wear daily that looks nice too.
review.name: Comfortable and Stylish

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Suede WP Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and can style like crazy with green color way!
review.name: Dope boots

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. Super cute and also held up to lots of hiking, breathable and comfy. I love the ankle cinch option. They're see-through so you have to consider your underwear choice. I got caught in a downpour in them and they are marketed as "quick dry" but they still took a few hours to dry, and the elastic waistband was still wet the next morning (to note: the environment was very humid). Will wear them a lot, just maybe not in the rain.
review.name: Fashion and function

review.reviewBody: I wear these casually and for hiking. They're comfortable, dry quickly and look super cute. Love that I can cinch the bottoms, like when I don't want mosquitoes to get my ankles. My only complaint is that I wish there was also a drawstring. I will likely need my pants altered as the elastic waistband stretches out and/or my weight fluctuates. Kinda figured that could be an issue with these when I bought them, though.
review.name: Pretty great!

review.reviewBody: Great travel pant. Very versatile and comfortable. Performed well during long hikes in the Alps under differing weather (wet and cool) and terrain conditions.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: They are see-though pants that are not designed for hiking, they are a fashion statement.
review.name: For appearances, not function

review.reviewBody: These are some of my favorite pants I'll be ordering more they are light breathable and can wear for almost any occasion
review.name: Amazing pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really liked how these pants fit me, but I expected the material to be thicker. Even my seamless beige underwear was seen through the pants. Had to return them.
review.name: Totally transparent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants did not work at all for me. I returned them.
review.name: No, I would not buy these again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light and comfy. Sometimes I wear a M in TNF and sometimes a S. Bought these in S and they are perfect, though I better not gain weight. Love them and am ordering a 3rd in another color. Great for summer coverage but thin and light for summer temperatures. 5'6", 130 lbs size S in this.
review.name: Going back for a third color

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the side pocket and the material is very breezy and light but it is too baggy on the bottom. I can see this pants would look good on a tall slender person. Maybe it is new hip fashion but it is not for every shape and unfortunately is not for me:(
review.name: too baggy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Basically see through! Overpriced for material and design. Very disappointed.
review.name: Overpriced and see through

name: Spring Peak Cargo Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I walk every day 2 1/2 to 3 miles. It's been very cold here in Connecticut and we even have gotten snow. Today was very cold. I always wear my new gloves, my Northface hat and my Northface gloves always warm. I also wear my Northface puffer jacket. The gloves have kept my hands very, very warm. I am an older woman, so my hands get very shaved, and I've noticed that my hands are protected very well with these gloves and I absolutely love everything Northface
review.name: I would buy this product again these gloves either for mysel

review.reviewBody: This doesn't provide warmth that you seek in winters.
review.name: Not likely for winters

review.reviewBody: I love the grippy palm and feel of the light warm fabric
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly, so glad they make an xs size. Good gloves for when heavy duty gloves would be too much and it's too chilly without gloves. I super helpful that they have grip bumps on it, as it makes it easier for me to grip a dog leash when walking my dog that pulls. Subtracting one star because the gloves are way overpriced for not even that much material you're getting etc.
review.name: Pretty good, but overpriced

review.reviewBody: These are my daughter's go to gloves right now. They are used for school, skating, and outdoor activities. They fit her well, are very comfortable, and stylish.
review.name: Great lightweight gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves have a great flex and keep my hands warm.
review.name: Warm and flexible

review.reviewBody: Best gloves ever. They're replacing my pair from last year that I had lost one on the first day that I wore them!
review.name: Etips actually work! I love them!

review.reviewBody: Quality is very good and works with the phone great!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Great for under gloves for snowboarding or just hiking!
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: I haven't use them, waiting for winter! I'll update my review once I start using them. Good size on my hands tho, I have small hands but long fingers.
review.name: Good size

review.reviewBody: I am thrilled with my recent purchase of a jacket. It is an absolute delight to wear as it is incredibly lightweight, yet provides ample warmth to keep me comfortable in chilly weather. What's more, the jacket serves a dual purpose - it can be worn as a mid-layer underneath a heavier coat on colder days or as a main layer in moderate weather. Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend this jacket to anyone looking for a versatile and cozy outerwear option.
review.name: Excellent light weight jacket

review.reviewBody: My husband liked the jacket a lot but he hoped it was thicker than the other Patagonia jackets he had. We were going to exchange it but the packed jacket (ready for mailing) found its way to the recycling bin, and sadly lost.
review.name: Nice but..

review.reviewBody:
For anyone wondering, I contacted Patagonia and the AlpLight uses 100 grams of 800-fill down, compared to the Down Sweater Jacket's 95 grams of 800-fill. 

Not sure why Patagonia refuses to list down fill weights on their website.  Rab and Feathered Friends make it easy to judge a down jacket's potential warmth by listing these facts.
review.name: Down Fill Weight - 100 Grams

name: AlpLight Down Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeps the baby warm and cute while I am working outside in the winter
review.name: So soft and fuzzy

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So soft and cute and cozy and warm. The first time he wore this out he got 12 compliments. Great quality.
review.name: Cozy little bear!

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is so cute, warm and fits perfectly around my baby’s head so it keeps her ears nice and warm!! There’s room for me to put her warm booties on in the cuffed pant leg (she’s not walking yet) to keep her feet nice and warm! Plenty of room to layer and trap heat! Also isn’t super fluffy so can be worn in the car seat on chilly morning rides! She is 8 months old but wearing mostly 12 month clothes (she’s a 98th percentile kinda gal)  and the measurements provided were spot on to have a nice roomy fit.
review.name: Perfect!

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I havent used it yet. I had to return the first one because it was too big. I ordered 18-24 months for my 20 month old and it was really big on her. She is on the smaller size, wearing 18-month clothes typically so im not sure if it runs big or my baby is just small. I haven't gotten the smaller size in yet. It was super cute on her when we tried it on.
review.name: Cute.

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great cozy for toddler's ver warm and soft looks and fits exactly like pics
review.name: Great teddy bear suit

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfectly adorable & great winter bunting! I use this kind of as a “layering” piece by putting baby in this and then into the stroller footmuff. I find that this is the perfect thickness to not overheat baby while out and about. So far tested well in 30-40 degrees Fahrenheit (NYC) + the stroller bag. 50 degrees and up he’s in this alone & it keeps him warm and happy on its own.
review.name: Adorable & warm bunting!

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such a beautiful and cozy piece. Love it for my baby.
review.name: Just wonderful

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well made, quality fabric and very warm. Size is much better than other products.
review.name: Great purchase

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love love love this bear suit! Daycare drop-offs are so easy with this easy all in one suit! Would highly recommend to anyone with a little one.
review.name: Cutest bear suit!

review.itemreviewed: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my son to wear when we go on walks this winter (we live in the Midwest). He wore it a few days ago and was very warm and cozy. This is an adorable outfit and great quality. The hand and foot covers worked well and we were thankful to have them. We had no trouble keeping his hood up either.
review.name: Great product!

name: Tiny Bear II Bunting - Infant Girls'

review.reviewBody: Ordered this jacket in Medium. Ended up returning as the Medium was a bit long, the pockets had a slightly funky location (sat a bit high) and the color was lighter than I expected. Good jacket, just not quite right for me.
review.name: Green was lighter in person than picture

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
This is warmer than it has any right to be, given how light it is.  In the low 30s, it is comfortable with just a T-shirt under it, if sedentary.  
Breathes pretty well, given how warm it is.
Packs up pretty small, for a non-down coat
Fits and looks great

Cons-
outer shell is too delicate.  I have gotten 2 rips just in the normal course of moving around.  If I'm wearing this in the woods, it has to be as a mid layer.  
It packs up small enough - why not make it packable into its own pocket?  I had needing to find a stuff sack
review.name: Warmer than you'd think

review.reviewBody: Runs large, too big to put a shell over, maybe layer an base and heavy mid layer to get it to fit properly.
review.name: Micro Puff Jacket

review.reviewBody: Nice and light.  Good for cool nights or day.  Good for layering.
review.name: Packable Jacket

review.reviewBody:
This became my favorite jacket!

I take it with me everywhere because it is very comfy and lightweight. 
The material feels high quality, durable, and still soft to the touch.
I bought it about 5 months ago and have worn it through rain, wind, and snow. I wouldn't recommend wearing it under heavier rain but it's done just fine with light rain.
The inside pockets are VERY roomy you can definitely fit an object the size of a 1L/32oz water bottle in there.
review.name: Absolutely love it!

review.reviewBody:
Just got the item today. First impressions:

1. I've had a Nano-puff Jacket for several years, size medium, regular fit. This Micro-puff jacket is also a medium, regular fit. The Micro-puff is noticeably bigger -- the body is much roomier and the sleeves are a bit longer. If Patagonia still had "relaxed" sizing, this would be a 'medium, relaxed fit' item. For me, it's fine; others expecting the old 'nano-puff' fit might be disappointed.

2. Note that, unlike the nano, the micro doesn't have a zippered inner pocket :-(    Not sure why but Patagonia doesn't think we need zippered inside pockets in pretty much anything.

3. Jacket works for my intended use. 4 Stars because no secure inside pocket.
review.name: Roomier than expected.

name: Micro Puff Insulated Jacket - Men's
